original_text:
Writing a strong and supported essay takes more than just advanced vocabulary and a plethora of facts . A strong example of this is the article "The Challenge of Exploring Venus". The author did not support his topic very well, because he didn't support his main idea enough, he strayed away from the topic many times, and his information is an abundance of opinions and assumptions.

First, the author brings up his topic of " Studying Venus is a worhty pursuit despite the dangers it presents". Despite this, the author only gave one full paragraph, out of the eight he wrote, on why humans would want to explore the planet ; he then preceeded to go onto the dangers of Venus, rather than why it is worth exploring. Secondly, the author ,many times, rambled on about other points that had nothing to do with his main idea. The author gave an entire paragraph about the new technologies that NASA is working on to explore Venus, even though his main idea is about why we should send shuttles to Venus. In the article it states " Another project is looking back to an old technology called mechanical computers. These devices were first envisioned in the 1800s and played an important role in the 1940s during World War II". This entire quote has nothing to do with the topic whatsoever, which shows that the author was gettting side tracked. One reading just this quote from the article would most likely think this article is about computers,and not why humans should explore Venus. Finally, the supporting evidence that the author did bring up, weren't very factual or even well thought out. One of the points brought up was "Venus was probably covered largely with oceans and could have supported various forms of life,just like Earth". The author uses the word "probably" which means that he doesn't know this to be a fact or not. The author also wrote "Astronomers are fascinated by Venus" ; this is an opinion, seeing as some astronomers might heavily dislike venus. A good informative or arguementative essay provides facts to supports its ideas, rather than just guessing or presuming.

The author does not suport his ideas well, because he draws the reader away from the topic many times, he doesn't support his thesis very well, and the evidence he does bring up are opinions or assumptions. The author provides to much on the "danger" aspect of it, and he should focus more on the "why" aspect of his idea . So, it would be best if he looked over his essay and ,with his thesis in mind, start over from scratch.

In the story A Cowboy Who Rode the Waves,is about a person who just graduated highschool. He had already been working two part-time jobs. Then his friend Don invited him to go to Europe on a cattle boat. He couldn't say no. Luke knew it was an opportuity of a lifetime. When they got their,Lke and Don signed up to take care of animals. In 1945 of August, they received their orders to go to New Orleans. They didn't arrive until August 14th.

When they arrived Luke and Don got their seaman papers and boarded the SS Charles W.Wooster, then headed forn greece. This opportunity was good for Luke because he had just graduated highschool. As they headed over sea, they had a cargo of 335 horses plus enough hay and oats to feed them. Before arriving Greece, Luke had turned 18 which ment he could be drafted for military service. By the time Luke was discharged in 1947, Luke had made nine trips

the most of any Seagoing Cowboy. Luke's carrer was getting farther and farther. He

was happy for his self.

original_text:
Join the Seagoing Cowboys program, you may enjoy it. In the Seagoing Cowboys program, we travel over to Europe and help the countries recover from World War II by recovering their food supplies, animals, and more, 44 nations joined together to form UNRRA which stands for "the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration" who hired the Seagoing Cowboys. Luke said he even had time to have fun playing multiple games when he had the chance. Luke even enjoyed being on an adventure with the Seagoing Cowboys. Join the Seagoing Cowboys today and you can travel across Europe.

The Seagoing Cowboys travel across the Seas to Europe to help it recover from World War II which harmed most of Europe. We'll travel across the Seas on the SS Charles W. Wooster. The SS Charles W. Wooster will be heading towards Greece with a cargo of 335 horses and enough hay and oats to feed them. This is an opportunity of a lifetime that you may never get again. Luke said "I'm grateful for the opportunity," because he enjoyed an adventure like this that the Seagoing Cowboys were on.

While you're with the Seagoing Cowboys, you can meet new people on the trip. You can go to new places that you never been to or never seen. The Seagoing Cowboys take care of horses, young cows, and mules that are going to be shipped overseas. Crossing the Atlantic Ocean will take about 2 weeks from the Eastern coast of the United States and it would also take a month to get to China. We hope you help the Seagoing Cowboys in their national service.

original_text:
Luke Bomberger had got asked to join this program called '' Seagoing Cowboys."

He was working at two part time jobs, one of the jobs were grocery store and the other one was the bank. Then, Lukes friend Don Reist invited Luke to go to the cattle boat in Europe. Luke couldnt say no because that has always been Lukes dream. Then he thought, that would be the opportunity of his lifetime to work on the cattle boat!

The reason Luke wanted to work onthe cattle boat was because the World War II just got done in Europe. He also wanted to help Europe get there food supplies, animals, and familys back together. Fourty-Four nations joined in on this program. The name of the program was called "Seagoing Cows" because they took care of the horses, young calfs, mules that were on there way over seas. Europe needed despirate help when this incident happened.

Acording to the story, on August 1945, they arrived on August 14th. On that day the Pacific War ended. They had a cargo with 335 horses plus hay and oats to feed them. Luke turned 18 when he was onthe cattle boat headed towrds Greece, and that meant he could be drafted to the military services! By the time he was discharged in 1947, Luke Bomberger had made nine trips, then he got told that he had the most Seagoing Cowboys trips in the program!

Luke always said "the cattle-boat trips were so unbelievable opportunity for a small town boy!" Besides helping people Luke had the benefit of seeing Europe and China. Seeing the Acropolis was very special, Luke said. He enjoyed being a Seagoing Cowboy.

Being a Seagoing Cowboy was much more than an adventure for Luke Bomberger. It opened up his world to help people and be kind and helpful to people who need help. A good reason for joining the Seagoing Cowboys program is because you can relize how you have good towns and good houses and some countries don't have that. It shows how you canbe helpful and you need to be greatful for what you have and dont have!

original_text:
You should join Seagoing Cowboys program! You might be thinking right now well why should I join this program? You should join because UNRRA hired ''Seagoing Cowboys'' to take care or the horses, young cows, and mules that where shipped overseas. Its a important job to take care of the animals there our resource! You get to see and vist amazing places! And when you are in the program you get to help people out and help them recover. Its a good and nice thing that you are helping people out.

In the book ''A Cowboy Who Rode the Waves.'' A character from that book name Luke joined the Seagoing Cowboys program. His friend Don Reist invited him to go to Europe on a cattle boat. Luke couldn't say no. He knew it was an opportunity of a lifetime! In 1945, World War II was over in Europe, and many countries where left ruins. To help these countries recover their food supplies, animals, and more, 44 nations joined together to form UNRRA ( the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration).

Then in August 1945, they received their orders to report to New Orleans. They arrived August 14. Luke then says,''the day the Pacific war ended.''

Luke turned 18 before arriving in Greece, which meant he could be drafted for military service. Then Luke was on a cattle-boat trip, they told Luke to just keep doing that for Luke's service. Luke was discharged in 1947, Luke had made nine trips-the most of any Seagoing Cowboy. For Luke the cattle-boat trips where unbelievable opportunity for a small-town boy, he says.

Besides Luke helping people, he had side benefit of seeing Europe and china. But seeing the Acropolis in Greece was special for Luke. And Luke got to go to a gondola ride in Venice , Italy,a city with streets of water. Luke also toured an excavated castle in Crete and marveled at the Panama Canal on his way to China. Maybe if you Join the Seagoing Cowboys program you can experience all these wonderful places like Luke did! And you can be helpful in this program.

On Luke second trip, he had to serve as night watchman. And his job was to check on all the animals every hour. Now, thats a tough job to do. But Luke was helpful and he did his job and he loves his job he does. To sum things up the jobs sometimes be a little hard to do but Luke never gave up on his job! So this is why you should join the program and help people out like Luke and Don did.

original_text:
This story is about Luke Bomberger a boy who rode the waves had no idea that his life would change soon after his graduation. He was working two part-time jobs in a grocery store and at a bank when his friend invited him to go to Europe on a cattle boat. He couldn't say no he knew it would be an opportunity for him. It was 1945,world war 2 was over in Europe and countries were left in ruins. To help these countries recover 44 nations came together and started UNRRA {The United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration}. UNRRA hired seagoimg cowboys to take care of the horses,young cows, and the mules.

The first reason to join the program is because they came together and started a group of 44 nations to help Europe. They hired ''Seagoing Cowboys'' to help the animals. They are trying to get the nation back together. Luke and Don signed up for it to. Heading over seas in August 1945, they recieved their orders to report to New Orleans. They arrived ''August 14,'' Luke sayed,the day the Pacific war ended.''

The second reason you should join the group is because '' The cattle-boat trips were an unbelievable opportunity for a small-town boy,'' he said.''Besides helping people, had the side benefit of seeing Europe and China. But seeing the Acropolis in Greece was special,'' he says. ''So was taking a Gondola ride in Venice,Italy,a city with streets of water.'' Luke also toured an excavated castle in Crete and marveled at the Panama Canal on his way to china.

The third reason why you should join the group is cause caring for the animals during the crossings kept luke busy. They had to be fed and watered two or three times a day. Bales of hayand bags of oats had to be pulled up from the lower holds of the ship. Stalls had to be cleaned. Helping out on his aunt Katie's farm as a boy had prepared luke for hard work.

In conclusion I think you can still help with or without an reward. He did that from heart to help and sign up for that, also he liked watching the animals every hour and taking care of them so did his friend. He really liked the trips around the world too, just help to be nice somtimes for other people.

original_text:
Being a Seagoing Cowboy is a great experience. You don't only help people, but you also get a benefit of seeing amazing places. If you love animals you can take care of them. You get to have fun and know that you're doing something that helps others.

Luke was just a small town boy and he got a great opportunity. First he had two part-time jobs at a grocery store and a bank. Luke was invited to be a Seagoing Cowboy by his friend Don. He accepted it and knew he was going to have a lifetime opportunity. Luke had a benefit of seeing Europe and China, saw the Acropolis in Greece, took a gondola ride in Venice, Italy, toured an excavated castle in Crete, and marveled at the Panama Canal on his way to China.

This job may be fun, but it still is a life changing experience. You see more than you could see just from home. You also know you're changing other people's lives. Luke may have had a wonderous adventure, but it also made him more aware of the needs in other countries.

original_text:
Luke had just graduated college and his friend Don Reist invited Luke to go to Europe with him. Luke said yes because it was an opportunity of a lifetime and he could not pass it up. Luke became a Seagoing Cowboy.

Luke said, "Being a Seagoing Cowboy he got to see Europe, China and he got to see the Acropolis in Greece." He got to see so many great sites. Luke toured an excaveted castle in crete and he marveled at the Panama Canal on his way to China.

Luke had to travel a lot. But, even though it took two weeks to cross the Atlantic Ocean from the eastern coast of the United states and a month to get to China. On the long journey

Luke stayed busy by taking care of animals. Taking care of animals and traveling was not all Luke did on the boat, the cowboys played lots of games. Some of the games they played was baseball and volleyball games in the empty holds where animals lived. They also did table-tennis tournaments, fencing, boxing, reading, whittling and other games to pass time.

Luke said that "being a Seagoing Cowboy was much more than an adventure." For Luke it opened up the world to him. Luke had a lot of fun seeing different sites, meeting new people, playing fun games and caring for people in a different, and better way.

Have you ever wanted to know what a Seagoing Cowboy is? Well, today you a going to learn what a Seagoing Cowboy is. You should join the Seagoing Cowboy progam because its a progam that delivers Animals, Food Supply, and or car parts. The Seagoing cowboy program was started in World War 2 it offically launched bussiness with the UNRRA to take care of the horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped overseas.

In paragraph 1, it states that," Luke Bomberger had no idea that his life would change soon after his High School Graduation. He was working two part-time jobs when his friend Don Reist invited him to go to Europe on a Cattle Boat." Also in paragraph 2, "It was 1945, World War II was over in Europe, and many Countries were left in ruins. To help these countries recover their food supplies, animals, and more, 44 nations joined together to form UNRRA. UNRRA hired "Segoing Cowboys" to take care of the horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped overseas.

Next, In August 1945, the received their orders to report to New Orleans. They got their seaman's papers and boarded the SS Charles W. Wooster, headed for Greece-with a cargo of 335 horses plus enough hay and oats to feed them.

Luke turned 18 before arriving in Greece, which mean he could be drafted for military service. By the time he was discharged in 1947, Luke had made nine trips the most of and Seagoing Cowboy

This is why i think you should join the Seagoing Cowboys Program because they help people with the food supply, water, and many other things

original_text:
The Seagoing Cowboys were great heroes to other country's because they transported food and horses for people who didn't have food or any transportation. Just think how good you would feel if you knew that you saved people lives just by giving them food. Well i'm going to tell you what it would feel like and why you should become a Seagoing Cowboy.

Just think of becoming a true life hero, you could become a soldier,nurse,doctor, or a Seagoing Cowboy! Seagoing Cowboys were people (men) who transported Cows, Mules, and Horses. They transported them from America to Europe,Greece,and China. Europe was left in ruins after World War || was over, so people signed up to become a Seagoing Cowboy. They would get on ships with 300+ horses, cows, and mues and enough hay and oats to feed them. A Seagoing Cowboy would check up on them every hour to make sure the animals were alright. Wow what a job.

This story is mainly about how great Seagoing Cowboys are and what they bring to other countries. They transported animals to other countries who didn't have food or transportation. Seagoing Cowboys were true heroes, they cared for animals and people. They had kind hearts for both of them.

original_text:
The main characters were Luke and her friend. Basically the story is about her friend giving her a once in a life time opportunity. She first worked at a grocery store and and the bank. When her friend invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat. She couldnt say no. So then she went.

She had graduated from high school and had 2 jobs but whem her friend invited her to Europe her whole llife had changed. Since there was a war she went to go help out. She and Don had signed up to be a segoing cowgirl. 44 nations joined toggether and formed a UNNRA and she was hired to be a seagoing cowgirl. That when you have to take care of horses , mules adnd young cows. That was her job over there in Europe.

She kept going there and she kept helping others. She like her job. The cattle boats were unbelievable for a small town girl it had said. She really enjoyed her job. She toured lots of places like Venice Italy and a city with streets of water. But Luke had made 9 trpis the most of any seagoing cowgirl. She traveled across the atlantic ocean and it took her about 2 weeks.

She was taking care of lots of animals and was feeding them 2 or 3 times a day. Bales of hay and bags of oats. They had to be pulled. She had helped out her aunt Katie as a girl. So she was prepared for this. On her second trip she was served as a night watchman. Her job was to check the animals every hour. Then one rainy night she had slipped down on a slippery ladder. Her heart raced. But luckly she lived.

This ssums up about everythung. Her life had changed a whpole lot. Thanks to her friend Don. She liked helping out. She couldnt work though because she had cracked ribs. After that she returned to being a seagoing cowgirl. Then it made her more aware of peopl in other countries and thier need.

original_text:
A argument Luke is dealing with from her point of view is how much things she has to do and if she does the commands wrong there will be horrible consequences for them.

When Luke heard about the job she was so excited about it. She heard that being a Seagoing Cowgirl was a amazing job. She has been dreaming about being a Seagoing Cowgirl because of all the animals you take care of and all the traveling they do. That's why right away when Luke heard that they are hiring Seagoing Cowgirls, she couldn't say no. It was a opportunity of a lifetime!

As soon as Luke got hired, she was so excited to start working. She worked and worked all the time. She wanted to be the best Seagoing cowgirl there has ever been. Sometimes she would work more than she was soppost to. She enjoyed taking care of the horses, young cows, and mules.

Luke worked very hard and sometimes got tired. She went to alot of places. She went to New Orleans and Greece and other places. As soon as she was done with all the traveling she made nine trips all together! She made more trips than any Seagoing Cowgirl!

Later on Luke kept working with all the animals. All the taking care of made Luke very busy, beside with the traveling. Luke also had to clean.

On Lukes second trip she served her night as a watchman. She had to check on all the animals every hour. But then a horrible thing happened. After making her hourly report to the captain, Luke slid down a slippery ladder on her backside. She landed feet first toward an opening on the side of the ship. A small strip of metel along the edge stopped her slide, that kept her from going overboard into the dark Alantic Ocean. But luckly for her she was still alive.

As soon as that insedant happened to Luke, she got her ribs cracked. Luke couldn't work for a couple of days. So while Luke was not going to work she managed her time to have fun on board. She played baseball and volleyball games in the empty holds where animals have been housed. She played alot more games aswell.

Later on being a Seagoing Cowgirl she thought of how amazing it feels to help people. She helped lots of people during her trips. So Luke had a great idea. She wanted people to help other people. She started to convince people to be a Seagoing Cowgirl. But most of people thought she was crazy. She told people how amazing it is to be traveling and amazing it is to be helping others.

People called her job dangerouse. It sure was. Luke got very annoyed and angry because people thought she was crazy and they did not like that kind of job. Luke stopped persuading people to be a Seagoing Cowgirl. But She didn't give up on her job though. She liked her job the way it is and she wouldn't change it for anything. She got awards for being a very helpful, admiring, and amazing person in her job.

Luke is a cow girl from the farm and she has two jobs. She works at the bank and the grocery store. When her old friend , Don Reist, invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat she could not say no. It was an oppertunity of a life time she left. She was helping other animals each and every animal that was hurt in every war that was going on.

Luke recived orders from to go to New Orleans. she did as she was told so she went to New Orleans and helped to take care of th animals as she was told.

Thier was many reasons why she joined but when she was eight teen she was alowed to join the army. When she told abuot her jurney here they said '' you just keep doing your service in helping out animals. '' It was a big honar for her to help animals she went all over the world to help animals.

She new that this was the best dission she ever made in her whole life. One reason she joined is that she was helping animals and felt like she was a heroine to the animals like saving people after big events. She was proud of helping animals and loved to be with them till they get back home safe and soud.

Luke was always on an ocean and she went all over the world helping animals. She was always doing something with animals till she slipped and broke her ribs but she would always helping animals even if she was hurt.

Another reason you should join is an adventure waiting fo you. It will open the world to you like it opened the world for Luke and she was grateful for that. You will learn the needs for other countries and it will stick to you.

original_text:
Luke didnt know what was going to happen after high school graduation. She was working at a grocery store and a bank(part time).Her friend invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat. She didnt want to say no and she knew this will be an opportunity of a lifetime. She joined the program she wanted to do something together w/ her friend. She wanted to joined the program because she to try something new why she had the chance.

She signed up to be a Seagoing Cowgirl. Being a Seagoing Cowgirl,you have to take care of animals such as, horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped overseas. Luke didnt want to just work for a grocery store and a bank, she wanted to do something else like being a Seagoing Cowgirl. Would you like to keep working at a grocery store and bank? I wouldn't because, I would want to try the opportunity that is offered and see what will happen.

Luke had to make alot of trips to get to where she was getting to. She made 9 trips. People thought that it was unbelievable opportunity for a smalltown girl. She says that she had the side benefit of seeing Europe and China. She thinks the Acropolis in Greece was special. Luke also tuored an excavated castle in Crete and marveled at the Panama Canal on her way to China.

original_text:
In this essay I will be writing a detailed argrument convincing enough for others to join the Seagoing Cowgirls progam. Soon after her high school graduation, her friend invited her to join the program. Luke thought about it and decided to sign up with her friend after she realized it was a once in a lifetime opportunity. Luke knew that it was hard work, but she learned about all hard work on her aunt Katie's farm. This all changed her life, but for the better.

Luke has gone to her first trip for Greece. While she is there she finds beautiful landmarks such as when she saw the castle in Crete and the Panama Canal. She had explored Greece, and seen the Acropolis in Greece. Luke has also taken a gondola ride in Venice,Italy. Bomberger has also had much fun on these trips where she and the cowgirls played games such as baseball and volleyball when there was empty holds from where the animals were housed. They would also have boxing, reading, fencing, whittling, and table-tennis tournaments. Luke and the other cowgirls got a lot more expeirence working with animals, especially barnyard animals. The "Seagoing Cowgirls" sure learned a lot from these trips.

For Bomberger this has made her appreciate her life more. She has hosted many international students and exchange visitors for this reason. All of her overseas trips have taught her her value and how luck she is. The "Seagoing Cowgirls" was more to her than an aventure. It was a life lesson.

original_text:
Luke was going to China, because her friend asked her and she said she couldn't pass this up. In the text it says that Luke had no idea that her life would change once she graduated high school. She was working two part time jobs. She knew it was an opportunity of a lifetime. the United Nations Relief and rehabiliation Administartion hired "Seagoing Cowgirls" to take care of the horses, young cows, and the Mule that were shipped overseas. Luke and Don helped and signed up for it. Luke turned 18 before arriving in Greece. When she finally got there she helped on her Aunt Katie's farm. She went on a second trip. The cowgirls all got along and began playing table tennis tournaments, baseball,volleyball games, and boxing and the games helped pass some time for the cowgirls. The cowgirl, also known as Luke Bomberger, lead her family to hostess a number of international students and exchanged visitors for many years. They arrivred in China August 14, the day the Pacific war ended. I bet her family was very proud of her. When she turned 18 I bet she was excited because she could be drafted for miltary service. Then when her board learned that she was on a cattle boat trip they told her to just keep doing that for service.

The reason you should join the Military is because you could save a life. Several of lives. Also because we probably need more people because we could always use more people to protect us. Luke made nine trips after 1947.

Then when her board learned that she was on a cattle boat trip they told her to just keep doing that for service.

The reason you should join the Military is because you could save a life. Several of lives. Also because we probably need more people because we could always use more people to protect us. Luke made nine trips after 1947.    ]"

original_text:
Luke Bomberger went on many adventures. She helped cattle animals and people in need. On her adventures, Luke saw many historic landmarks. She saw things such as the Acropolis in Greece and the Panama Canal. On her way back from her trip, she usually played games. She had a fun time.

Luke Bomberger had two part-time jobs in a grocery store and a bank. One day, her friend, Don Reist, invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat. She knew it was an opportunity of a lifetime. To help countries in need to get food supplies, 44 nations joined together to form UNRRA (the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration) and they hired "sea cowgirls" to help countries in need. It was 1945 and the end of World War II in Europe when Luke and Don signed up to become a sea cowgirl.

In August 1945, Luke and Don received orders to get a boat in New Orleans. They boarded the SS Charles W. Wooster and headed for Greece. On the way, Luke turned 18, which ment she could be drafted for military service. When the military found out that Luke was a sea cowgirl, they decided to let her do that for service. Luke went many places such as Greece, Crete, Panama, and Italy. She spent the rest of her life at her home.

Sea cowgirls get to go lots of places, according to the text above. Luke went to places such as Panama and Italy. Why don't you sign up to be a sea cowgirl? Sea cowgirls get to travel the seas and see different places. Sea cowgirls help people. Sea cowgirls travel. I don't see why you shouldn't become a sea cowgirl.

Sea cowgirls helped many people in the 1940's. Luke Bomberger traveled many places and helped many people. She is a legend among the sea cowgirls. Sea cowgirls got to see many places and different countries. Sea cowgirls helped the military. Sea cowgirls got to go down the Panama canal and ride on boats through the canals in Italy. You should become a sea cowgirl too.

original_text:
Luke Bomberger was a seagoing cowgirl. She crossed the Atlantic Ocean 16 times and the Pacific twice to help people affected by world war ll. She took care of horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped overseas.

Along her trip she got chance to visit many places. She had the benefit of seeing Europe and China. But to her seeing the Acropolis in Greece was special she also said that taking that gondola ride in Venice, Italy also was.

She fed and watered the animals and cleaned the stalls. Bales of hay and bags of oats had to be pulled from the lower holds of the ship and thats what Luke did. During the crossings caring for the animals kept Luke busy.

She was a watchman and had to look out on the animals every hour and report back to the captian. One day she was doing her normal rutien, and she had slid down a slippery ladder an her backside and when she slid a small strip of metal along the edge stopped her slide, kepping from falling overboard in the Atlantic ocean. Helping on her aunt Katie's farm when she was young had prepared luke for hard work.

In the story it tells you of a woman named Luke Bomberger and what she did as a Seagoing Cowgirl. It doesn't really try to convince you to participate in the program but if you do you can get some details from what she did to what you might do if you joined. After this program she said "it made me more aware of people of other countries and their needs."

original_text:
Luke Bomberher had no idea that her life would change soon after her high school graduation. She was working a two part-time jobs in a grocwry store and a bank when her friend Don Reist invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat. Luke couldn't say no. She knew it was an opportunity of a lifetime.

When Luke and Don got there they were so happy. That is when Luke relized that she wanted to serve there.

Lukealso wanted to help. She says that seeing the Acropolis in Greece was special. That is one of the reasons why she wants to serve and help.

Helping out on Luke's aunt Katie's farm as a girl had prepared her for hard work, but not for the dangers at sea. On her second trip, Luke served as night watchman. Her job was to check on all the animals every hour. One rainy night, after making her hourly report to the captain, she slid down a slipperu ladder on her backside. Likes heart raced as she shot feet first toward an opening on the side of the ship. She was safe.

Luke is now a Seagoing Cowgirl snd is much more adventurous. It opened the eorld to her, and now Luke Bomberger is reslly happy.

These are some reasons from the story "A Cowgirl Who Rode the Waves, " and why she wanted to join the program.

original_text:
Luke wanted to join the Seagoing Cowgirls program because she knew it would be an opportunity of a lifetime. When Luke went she would be helping horses, young cows, and mules being shipped over seas to a new locatation she had to help gather suplies, animals and many other things supplies to help out things that had gone wrong also 44 nations joined together to help them out.

In one of Luke's trips there had been more then 335 plus enough hay to feed all of them. By time Luke had turned 18 she had arrived in Greece which meant she could go into the military service. When Luke had been discharged she had maken more then nine trips, that is the most any Seagoing Cowgirl has ever gone in this service. It took the Seagoing Cowgirls two weeks to cross the Alantic Ocean from the United States, and on top of it took them a month to get to China.

When Luke was younger she used to help out on her Aunt Katie's farm, this helped her to learn her hardworking skills but never trained her for the dangers at sea. She had decided that helping out in the Seagoing Cowgirls and all of the animals, and food services was worth all the help that her and her pals had given. It was real rainy one night after making her hourly check up on the horses to report to the captain when she had slipped down a slippery ladder ship cracking some of her ribs so then she couldn't do her job for a couple of days.

Luke also had a lot of fun on board with all of her friends. When the animals had been unloaded they played baseball, volleyball, fencing, table tennis and a lot more sports and game. Luke said that being a Seagoing Cowgirl was way much more then an adventure she had opened up the world for Luke. She was very grateful for her jouney, it mad her more aware of the other countries and there needs.

Luke had learned everything from helping out animals to teamwork. Luke thought seen that helping other countries is fun but you do have to learn teamwork and much more. When she had broken some of her ribs she had to stop working her job for a while. When she got back on the job she was feeling very happy for what she had just accomplished for the world.

" It's 2016 and i still look young!" said Luke. she was the cowgirl who rode waves "Ok mom since Forever ago!" said her daughter. She was in town for special reasons.

" Can you tell me a story of when you were young?" her daughter asked. " Oh all right,but just one. When I was young I was a wave surfer and-" she was enturupted by her daughter. " that part changes every time last time you told me this story it was a sailor and then it was a -" "Alright mabey I was just a gal on a cattle boat." she said.

" Her daugter laughed at her, just a gal on a cattle boat,huh." she said "Hey it payed the bills, got food on the table,and payed the hospital bills too!" she said angerly. Her dauhter sat there with nothing to say. "You promised to never talke about her ever again!" not knowing what she said. she left the room with nothing to say.

She left the hous got in her car and drove off without a hug or a kiss goodbye. She never had done this before. She never knew her mother.

But of course she came back and she talked about her journeys to china and all different places.

After highschool Luke Bomberger never thought her life would not change. She was worked two part-time jobs in a grocery store and a bank when her friend Don invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat. Luke couldn’t say no. She knew it was a once in a lifetime opportunity.

Don and Luke went to help they people my taking care of their cattle after everything is left in ruins. Right before arriving to Greece, Luke turned eighteen. Now that she was a legal adult she could be drafted for the army. When they heard of what she was doing they told her to carry on.By the time she was discharged it was 1947 and she had made nine trips most as a Seagoing Cowgirl.

After the animals had been unloaded they had fun playing baseball, volleyball, and many other activites. Being a Seagoing Cowgirl opened the world to Luke. Like said that she was greatful for the opportunity and she is now aware of the people and countries in need.

You should join the Seagoing Cowgirls program! You should join it because you get to help others and animals. Also it not just a plus for them it is one for you too. Even herself she said, '' It opened a whole new world for me'' She helped animals and more when the World War Two happend. She recovered their food supplies. She went accrosed the Atlantic Ocean 16 times and the Pacific Ocean twice to help people affected by World War two, that would be a sight to see.

When you are a Seagoing Cowgirl you have a responsibility to help animals and more! But it can also be dangerous crossing the oceans all the time. If you want to be a Seagoing cowgirl you have to be brave and courageous! You need those traites because if that was your job you would'nt want to be nervous or afraid all the time.

Luke had too be brave she had to have a great outlook to kept doing what she was doing, And you can too! Her point of veiw was strong. She went on 9 trips and that is the most of any Seagoing Cowgirl! She also had a cargo of 355 horses plus enough hay and oats to feed them! She even cracked her ribs, but she is ok. Over something small but she was brave enough to keep going because she cared for the animals and she loved her job.

original_text:
Across the Sea and Beyond

"Come on please,it will fun" as Luke Bomberger begs you to join the Seagoing Cowgirls. Luke is trying to get people to join the Seagoing Cowgirls. In this paperit will be adresssing some reasons and claims from Luke of why a perosn should join the Seagoing Cowgirls.

Luke claims that during her adventures as a Seagoing Cowgirl that she gets to visit lots of places when the Seagoing Cowgirls go to China, Europe, and many other places. Once she got to see the Acropolis in Greece. Another time when Luke got to go a place in Europe is when she toured an excavated castle in Crete. Luke also got to go to Vencie, Italy and take a gonodola ride. Another fanizitic time Luke got to tour was the Pamama Canol on her way to China. That's why Luke claims during her adventures she got to go many different places as a Seagoing Cowgirl.

Luke also claims that before arriving in Greece she had her eighteenth birthday, which ment she could be drafted by the military. When the draft board learned that Luke was on a cattle-boat trip they made a deal with Luke stating that she could work on a cattle-boat for instead of military service. After two years of cattle-boating Luke was discharged she had the most trips of any Seagoing Cowgirl she had nine. Thats why Luke claims instead of fighting in the military a person could be a Seagoing Cowgirl and bringing animals like horses and cows to people in need acrcoss the sea in Europe, China, or other countires that need help and food after battle or a major war that they lost.

As one may see that there are many great benefits of becoming a Seagoing Cowgirl.

original_text:
Have you ever read the story A Cowgirl who rode the waves? I know I have, it's a book about a girl who is invited to Europe and she becomes a Seagoing Cowgirl after World War 2. This book includes being a Seagoing Cowgirl, the Seagoing Cowgirl has to take care of animals on a ship and a girl named Luke explores

First, the Seagoing Cowgirl, a Seagoing Cowgirl is a Cowgirl who takes care of animals over sea or on a boat. The Seagoing Cowgirl in the story was no different she took go care of the animals. Everyday she watered and fed the animals 2 to 3 times a day. When Luke first became a Seagoing Cowgirl she knew it was going to be alot of hard work so she worked as hard as she could. I can infer that if Luke had not took good care of any of the animals they all would be dead.

Next, Luke Bomberger explores, in the story,it states that Luke visited Europe, China and she explored the Atlantic ocean. and also the text states that Luke also found time to have fun aboard the ship, especially on the return trips after the animals had been unloaded. I can infer that if I was a Seagoing Cowgirl I would not survive working as hard as Luke did.

Last, Being a Seagoing Cowgirl,by reading the text,being a Seagoing Cowgirl is alot of work. In the text it says being a Seagoing Cowgirl was much more than an adventure for Luke Bomberger. It opened the world to her. And in Luke's own words she said It made me more aware of people of other countries and thier needs. Also being a Seagoing Cowgirl can be dangerous because when Luke was night watchman on a rainy night, she slipped on a ladder and cracked her ribs but thankfully she didn't fall in the Atlantic ocean because their was a small strip of metal along the edge of her side. I can infer that if that small metal strip was not there Luke would most likely be dead.

Now you know how the Seagoing Cowgirls worked, how they took care of animals and how Luke explored. Now, if you want to achieve something like Luke did then get out there and show everyone that you can do what you dream to do.

Secondly Luke says "The cattle-boat trips were an unbelievable for a small-town girl." Besides helping others she likes to taking water rides Venice, Italy. Her friend Don Reist confnced her to come out and see her, but not only see her but to go cattle boating with her. But yet not only did Luke do the program and gets to hang out with her friends she gets to experence new thngs.

original_text:
Being a Seagoing Cowgirl was one of the best times of Luke's life. She got to travel the world and explore. And she got to help people around the world.

Paragraph 3 tells us about how in August 1945, Luke received orders to go to New Orleans. She arrived Agust 14, 1945. There Luke got my seaman's papers and boarded the SS Charles W. Wooster headed for Greece. On the ship were a 335 horse cargo with hay and oats to feed them. In paragraph 4 we learn that Luke turned 18 before she made it to Greece. This meant she was able to be drafted for military service, but her draft board said that she should just keep the service she already had. Luke was discharged in 1947, but she had made nine trips by that time, the most of any Seagoing Cowgirl. Not only did Luke help people, but she also got to see Europe and China. Paragraph 5 tells us how Luke got to see the Acropolis in Greece and how she take a gondola ride in Venice, Italy.

Being a Seagoing Cowgirl was a lot more than an advemture for Luke. In paragraph 9 she quotes, "I'm grateful for the opportunity," she says. "It made me more aware of people in other countries and their needs."

original_text:
Luke just got out of high school. She now has two jobs, one at the store the other at a bank. Then out of thin air her friend don ivites her to go on a trip. Don was going to Europe on a cattle boat to help people in ruins from World War II. so Luke thinks, this is a opportunity of a lifetime so she said yes to Don.

So they get on the boat where they are taking 335 horses plus their food. The whole crew takes turn caring for them. There are also nightwatch women who watch the animals through out the night. On one rainy night Luke was the watchman she went to tell the captain her hourly report. After she did she slid down a slippery ladder and landed on her backside. Her heart raced as she shot feet first toward an opening on the side of the ship. A small piece of metal stopped her from going overboard. She was happy to be alive but she could not work for a few days because she had cracked ribs.

She turned 18 on a trip to Greece, which meant she could be drafted for military service. When her draft board found out that she was on a cattle boat trip they told her to keep doing trips. Lukes most fun times where on the way back from somewhere. Because they had dropped off all of the animals so they could play in the huge place where they had been.

And after all of the adventures she was happy that she had the opportunity to do that it really opened up the world to her.

Luke enjoyed the life of being a seagoing cowgirl but she thought it would be even better if more people had the opportunity to be a seagoing cowgirl. Luke thought that the adventures and the different places were awesome so she convince people to become a seagoing cowgirl. As soon as she got onto land she started telling everyone about all the fun and all of the adventure. Soon she ran into a woman named Stuart and started telling her all about the mystery, excitement, and the fun that came with being a seagoing cowgirl.

"Imagine it" said Luke "going places you've never gone before, doing thing you've never even heard of, and lastly seeing sights you've never seen before." Stuart thought about it for a moment and then she decided to become a seagoing cowgirl. Soon enough Stuart, Luke, and many new members were looking for places to go and people who wanted to join them.

Soon enough there were so many members that not only were there a couple groups but a lot and it was all because of Luke. All the seagoing Cowgirls liked the excitement and everything about being a seagoing cowgirl. For many years all the seagoing Cowgirls sailed the seas happily.

A Cowgirl Who Rode the Waves

Luke Bomberger wanted people to join the Seagoing Cowgirls program

because you help young cows, and mule that were shopped overseas. So Luke and her friend Dan signed up for the Seagoing Cowgirls program.

Luke and her friend Dan got their orders received so they can report to New Orleans. So after that they boarded the SS Charles W. Wooster they were headed to Greece. They had 335 horses and alot of hay and ats to feed them on the way to Greece. Luke and her friend Dan wanted to join the Seagoing Cowgirls program because they could help all the animals that were shipped overseas and that were hurt. So Luke and Dan helped all of the animals and got the better. Luke was happy because she also got to see the Acropolis in

Greece and she also got to take a gondola ride in Venice.

When luke ws almost arriving in Greece she turned 18 which meant she could be drafted in the military services. When Luke's draft board learned that she was on a cattle-boat trip they said why don't you just keep doing that for her service.When Luke was part of the cattle-boat trip it was an unbelievable opportunity for someone like her. She said "besides helping people she got to see Europe and China. The exciting part was that she got to go to Greece and see the Acropolis and go on the gondola ride in Venice.

Luke got a job as a night watchman. Her job was to check on the animals at night time. When she had the job as a night watchmen she slid down the slippery slide on her backside and cracked some of her ribs so she couldn't do her job for a couple of days. Luke said "it made her more aware of

people of other countries and their needs.

In this paragraph will be talking about the young woman on her way to eroup Luke Bomberger. Some people say that it was dangerous but I say she did a heroic act by bring cattle and horses to war torn countries. Now we think why she did that for so long, it wasent money, fame, or even for herself. No she did that selfless act for those people who had nothing left after war war 2. If you ask thats why she did it to help those women, women, and children, of china germany italy and all sorts of places that were left in ruins.

In this paragraph will be talking about Luke's claims. Such as she knew it was an opprotunity of a life time. That is supported by parts of the story were she may have to work but has fun in between her hard work. Like when in italy she visits such places like Crete or the Acropolis. There were also bad times like when she fell of that slipery ladder and broke some of her ribs in a storm and almost fell over board if it wasent for a small metal bar holding her in.

For a second lets talk about the time she spent overseas. We look at the fun she had in her nine adventures. Such as when she first visted Greece. She went to the Acropolis, soon after she visited the Panama Canal. Those were just some of the places that she got to travel not includeing Venice or Crete or even China.

In the end all you can say about Luke Bombriger is that she tried to help people. She was so selfless that even broken ribs couldnt stop her form doing whats right. There are only words that can discribe her charachter, selfless, kind harted. The number one thing you can call her this and simply this human.

original_text:
From Luke's experieance she know's that she is lucky to life in america. And that other people in other countires don't get a chance to live a good life. So Luke let people from other places stay at her home so they could go to a good school. And that awarness stayed with her for the rest of her days. Like she said it was an opportunity of a life time.

Luke had just graduated from high school and was working 2 part time jobs. One at the bank. One at the grocery. Untill one day her friend Don Reist came along and asked her to be a "Seagoing Cowgirl" with her. She knew this was the oppertunity of a life time. So obivisly she went.

In August 1995, World War ll was over in Europe, many countries were gone. So luke and the other Seagoing Cowgirls were sent there with food, animals, and more. Luke and her friend were shiped over seas to help as part of the UNRRA. She was shocked to see all the countries ruined. There was nothing left!

After all of that she was shiped to China with lots of suplies. One her way she got to see ols castles. She also traveled down the Panama Canal. The aniamls keep Luke very busy. They needed to be feed 3 times a day. They played lots of ball games to pass the time. Like volleyball and table tennis.

Being a

Seagoing Cowgirl was much more than an adventure to Bomberger. On all over her nine missions she learned that she was very lucky. LIke she said,"It made me more aware of people of other countries and thier needs." And the awareness stayed with her, she became a hostess for international students and exchage visitors for many years. That oppertunity chaged Luke Bomberger's live forever! We are very lucky to live in the USA becuase we have many more oppertunities the anyone else does.

original_text:
Do you think its a good idea to be a sea going cowgirl? well befor you anser that let me tell you a little story about a girl who was a seagoing cowgirl. Luke Bomberger was a young girl fresh out of highschool working two part-time jobs. Luke thought that she would probably be stuck working two jobs for a while, but thats were things change her freind Don Reist had invited her to Europe on a cattle boat. Luke couldnt resist , she had to go she thought. this was an opportunity of a life time she thought. Luke was one of the lucky people to be a sea going cowgirl. Even though luke was scared at first she ended up loveing it. they played games in thee free time like baseball, volleyball, they held tennis tournaments they also had fenceing and boxing tournament.

Luke loved getting to travel. She got to go to Greece when she was only 18 years old. Luke had made nine trips before she was discharged in 1947. Luke also went to Europe, China, and Italy were she got to take a gondola ride. This oppertunity can change your life for the better. There any many jobs of being a sea going cowgirl.Being a seagoing cowgirl can be dangeous at times, on lukes second trip she worked as a watchman. Her job was to check on all the animals every hour. One rainy night after makeing her hourly report to the captian she slid down a slippy ladder on her backside . Luckly she didnt go over board but she was still hurt with some cracked ribs.

Do you think its a good idea to be a sea going cowgirl. Yes theres dangers but along with danger comes excitement. being an sea going cowgirl gives you the oppertunity to help many people and familys that need food or medical help. being a seagoing cowgirl can let you see all the needs in other countries. Luke was a leader to her family by haveing a number of international students and exchange vistors for many years. Being a seagoing cowgirl thaught Luke to want to help others. After world war two many countries were left in ruins. To help these countries recover fortyfour nations joined together to form UNRRA ( the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administrateion) . UNRRA

hired " Seagoing Cowgirls "to take care of the horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped over seas luckily Luke and Don signed up to take care of the animals. Wouldnt you like to help out all these types of animals and get ot go on exciteing adventures .

original_text:
If you like traveling and helping out then heres a job for you.

Being a Seagoing Cowgirl can be very instresing.

Luke is a Seagoing Cowgirl.

Luke enjoys being a Seagoing Cowgirl.

Luke travels alot while being an seagoing cowgirl.

They traveled on cattle-boats, she says it was an unbeliveable opportunity.

In 1945, World War II had ended in Europe.

Many contries were ruined.

UNRRA hired the Seagoing Cowgirls.

UNRRA hired them to take care of horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped overseas.

In August 1945, they had gotten orders to go to New Orleans.

That day they arrived, the Pacific War had ended.

In 1947, Luke had gone on nine trips, the most a Seagoing Cowgirl has been on.

It took her about to weeks to cross the Alantic Ocean from the eastern coast of the United States.

It also took a month to get to China. When she cared for animals during the crossings it kept her busy on the trips.

Alough the sea can be dangerous, she liked it.

On Luke's second trip, she was a watchman.

She had to keep eyes on all the animals every hour.

On a rainy night, she acidently slide down a slippery ladder on her back.

She got super scared, her heart raced.

She shot down a slide, feet first.

A small strip of metal along the edge stopped the slide, keeping her from flying overboard.

She had an injury, she had cracked ribs.

When the girls had free time they had fun.

They played volleyball and baseball. They also liked to play table-tennis, fencing, and boxing. They also read.

They helped pass the time when she nothing to do.

Being a Seagoing Cowgirl can open up a whole new world to you.

It makes you more aware of people's needs.

That is what it is like to be a Seagoing Cowgirl.

Do you become a Seagoing Cowgirl now?

You should, it could be really fun.

Just try not to get hurt like Luke.

On a rainy night, she acidently slide down a slippery ladder on her back.

She got super scared, her heart raced.

She shot down a slide, feet first.

A small strip of metal along the edge stopped the slide, keeping her from flying overboard.

She had an injury, she had cracked ribs.

When the girls had free time they had fun.

They played volleyball and baseball. They also liked to play table-tennis, fencing, and boxing. They also read.

They helped pass the time when she nothing to do.

Being a Seagoing Cowgirl can open up a whole new world to you.

It makes you more aware of people's needs.

That is what it is like to be a Seagoing Cowgirl.

Do you become a Seagoing Cowgirl now?

You should, it could be really fun.

Just try not to get hurt like Luke.    ]"

original_text:
Luke bomberger had an interesting story to tell about her adventures on board the SS Charles W. Wooster. She saw many beautiful places and met many interesting people, as such she would recommend the program to somebody. In the following paraghraphs I will present luke's arguement and hopefully convince you to join "The Sea Going Cowgirls.

Luke starts her story as a young girl [fresh out of high school] working at a grocery store and a bank, when her friend Don Reist invited her to work on a cattle boat with her. She accepted and went off on the cattle boat bound for europe. Luke seems to have had fun working with the 335 horses on their first trip to europe and before arriving in Greece, luke turned 18. As such she was drafted.

Luke was told just to continue working on the boat for her servince so she spent another two years working on the boat. She says that she helped alot of people in China and Europe but she also got the benifit of seeing wonderful sights and places; like the Panama Canal and Acropolis or Venice. She says that aside from her adventures she learned of how lucky she is to have things like food and a job when people in the countries she visited were much less fortunate.

Enough about all this seriousness, let's talk about the fun activities on the ship. Luke said that the women on-board played all kinds of games like Base-ball and volleyball in empty holds when the animals were gone. The women also enjoy games like boxing fencing and best of all, reading; the women also had tournaments for table tennis.

So, in short you get paid for working a third of the time, exploring foreign countries the second third of the time and playing games the last third of the time. There's no other way to describe it other than "Best job ever."

At first she worked at a to part time job a banking and grocery store and then her freind invited her to be on a cattle boat luke could not say no to her.

The reason she joined was because her friend offerd she the job and she new it would be worth a life time of fun so she joined. Why because she wanted to have a new and fun job. And to help devistated countriesthat need help getting food and water and livestock. When she was walking around the boat to check on the animals she climbed a slipper ladder and losed her grip and started sliding towards the side of the boat. But their was a peice of metal that grabed her coat and stoped luke from going over board.

So she joined it was right after World War II and many counteries were left devistated and alot of countries needed food, water and livestockand then fortyfour nations joined together to help countries in need and the. Contries were caled the (United Nations Relief and Rehabitation Administration) Also nown as the UNRRA.

She said that she broke two ribs so she could not work the next day but after that she said it was a fun job. To have when they unloaded the animals the get to play volleyball, table-tennis, baseball, fencing and boxing. On the long journey back to america.

In Augast she recieved oders to report to New Orleans, she said we araived in August fourteenth, the day the Pacific war ended. they got their seamen's papers and boarded the SS Charles W. Wooster, headed for Greece- with a cargo of 335 horses plus enought hay and oats to feed them.

My argument about Lukes point of view is that you should always try soething new or something you always wanted to do. In this story Luke is working at a store and her friend invited her to go on a cattle boat to Europe after World War 2. She knew this would be an opportunity of a lifetime. So she went.

You could see how she was feeling just by the way the author put it. She was exicited and she was ready. When Luke found out that she was to take care of horses, young cows, and mules she knew she would be good at it because she worked at her aunts farm. She thought this would be a good time to help out with this disaster. Luke went overseas just to do someting helpful for the problems people had. All the stuff people had were gone because of the World War 2.

She had some rough times on way, like running into storms, big waves and other stuff that happen in the ocean, but hey it was worth it. But some thingss got severe, when she broke her ribs during a storm. She took nine trips on the cattle boat. And this was big for her because she was a small - town girl. She also knew she was helping out thousands of people. Over seas, Luke was very busy with the animals. She had to feed them 2 to 3 times a day. Thats a lot of work for young girl.

Just by reading this article you can tell how much work you will have but your doing it for people who can't do this stuff. So what, it may be hard, it may be boring, but those people need your help. Thats why you should join the Seagoing Cowgirls program. Luke was brave enough to do this kind of thing just because of 1 thing, she had faith in her, her best friend, and the people. Luke got to explore the world, also found time to have fun aboard after they got all the animals out, they played stuff like Table-tennis, fencing, boxing, reading, whittling, and those games helped pass the time. Being a Seagoing Cowgirl was much more than an adventure for Luke Bomberger. It opened up the world to her because she says that she's grateful for the opportunity to be a Seagoing Cowgirl.

As she speaks she says it made her more aware of people of other countries and their expectations. That awareness stayed with her,leading her family to hostess a number of international students and exchange visitors for many years.

original_text:
The United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration consists of,44 nations that came together to help countries recover their food supplies,animals and more.

They hired "Seagoing Cowgirls" to take care of the horses,young cows,and mules that were shipped overseas.

Luke Bomberger and her friend Don Reist signed up.

Luke exclaimed that besides helping people,she got to see other countries,such as Greece,and Europe.

She also toured an excavated castle in Crete.

Luke had to take care of the animals daily,they had to be fed and watered two or three times a day.

Food and bales of hay had to be brought up from the lower holds of the ship,and stalls had to be cleaned.

Luke said that helping out on her aunt Katie's farm as a girl prepared her for hard work, but not for the dangers of the sea,on her second trip luke served as a watchman.

Her job was to check on all of the animals every hour.

One time she said she slipped and fell on her backside and her heart raced as she shot feet first toward an opening side of the ship,thankfully a sharp peice of metal stopped her slide,or she would have flew overboard into the dark Atlantic.

She was happy to be alive,but she could not work for a couple of days due to cracked ribs.

Luke also found fun on board,especially on return trips.

When the animals had been unloaded,the cowgirls played baseball and volleyball games in empty holds where animals had been housed. Table-tennis tournaments,fencing,boxing,reading,whittling,and games also helped pass the time.

In conclusion, she feels that being a Seagoing Cowgirl was much more than an adventure. Luke quotes,"I'm grateful for the oppurtunity,"she says. "It made me more aware of people of other countries and their needs." Lukes example of being a "Seagoing Cowgirl" shows how you today how,by being on a boat,can make a difference.

The author's points seem to come to one conclusion, and that is that we should explore Venus despite the risks. She supports this idea with many different examples and reasons.

One example of her supporting her idea is in paragraph 6. She says that the only way scientist can understand Venus is by taking a risk and to think of it as a challenge. This supports her claim because hes saying to take a risk and explore Venus, despite the obstacles. Another thing she seems to push alot as a reason we should explore Venus is that we just don't have alot of knowledge about it. An example of this is in paragraph 2, when she said not a single space space craft has landed on venus in over three decades.

Another way she supports her idea is in paragraph 8. She says that striving to meet the challenges presented by Venus has value. This really supports her idea because she's saying that exploring Venus is worth something. She also says space exploration shouldn't be limited by dangers and doubt, which would imply that she supports exploring Venus.

The author supports her idea that we should explore Venus more despite the risks well with many different reasons. Like how we have almost no knowledge about it. Or how we should take the risks as challenges and try to overcome them. In the end she supports her idea well and backs it up with valid claims.

original_text:
In the story "A Cowgirl Who Rode the Waves" Luke joins the Seagoing Cowgirl program.

In this story it talks about what Luke does on her journey so, this is what were are going to talk about.

In paragraph 1 it says Luke's friend Don Reist invited Luke to go with her to the Seagoing Cowgirl program and Luke did not turn the offer down because that was an opportunity of a lifetime.

In paragraph 4 it said that

Luke turned 18 before arriving in Greece, which ment she could be drafted for military service.

"When my drafy board learned that I was on a cattle-boat trip, they told me to just keep doing that for my service."

By the time she was discharged in 1947, Luke made nine trips-the most of any Seagoing Cowgirl.

In paragraph 5 there were some reasons she should join the Seagoing Cowgirls, and it said "The cattle-boat trips were an unbelievable opportunity for a small-town girl," she says.

"Besides helping people, I had the side benefit of seeing Europe and China.

But seeing the Acropolis in Greece was special,"

she says. "So was taking a Gondala ride in Venice, Italy, a city with streets of water."

Luke also toured an excavated castle in Crete and marveled at the Panama Canal on her way to China.

In paragraph 7 the way Luke's claim supported the outcome of the story.

Helping out on her aunt Katie's farm as a girl had prepared Luke for hard work, but not for the dangers at sea.

On her second trip, Luke served as night watchman.

Her job was to check on all the animals every hour.

One rainy night, after making her hourly report to the captain, she slid down a slippery ladder on her backside.

Luke's heart raced as she shot feet first toward an opening on the side of the ship.

A small strip of metal along the edge stopped her slide, keeping her from flying overboard into the dark Atlantic.

She was happy to be alive.

But she could not work for a couple days because of cracked ribs.

My conclusion of the story is in paragraph 9 when it says, But being a Seagoing Cowgirl was much more than an adventure for Luke Bomberger.

It opened up the world to her.

"I am grateful for the opportunity," she says.

"It made me more aware of people of other countries and their needs."

And that awareness stayed with her, leading her family to hostess a number of international students and exchange visitors for many years.

Luke really enjoyed the Seagoing Cowgirls program. If you like helping people or takeing care of things thin this is the job for you. The Seagoing Cowgirls helped take care of cows,hores, and mules that where over seas. Luke was 18 before arriving in Greece, that ment she could sing up for miliary service. She was on her cattle-boat trip when she signe u for the miliary. They had plenty of food and water to feed the anmials and themselves.

When you are a Seagoing Cowgirl you get to travel a lot of places. Luck had been on 19 trips before they discharged her in 1947. If you like traveling then this is for you. They went all the way to China and it took them one whole month. They went to a lot of different places. Luck though all of her trips where very special.

Luck had come a long way since she was a kid. Luck grew up in in the country. She helped her aunt Katie out on the farm. She didn't have the best life when she was a kid. When Luke became a Seagoing Cowgirl it opened up the world for her.

When Luke was a Seagoing Cowgirl it was much more than an advernture even though she did travel a lot. Luke was very greatful for the opportunity. Luke saw that other countries don't have a lot of stuff like we do. She saw that they where in need. That awareness stayed with her almost her whole life.

Luke didn't just work she had a lot of fun on board. They played a lot of games like fencing, boxing, table-tennis tournaments, games, reading, and whittling made the time go by pretty quick. It was a lot easier to play the games when the animals where unloaded.

She sometimes went to places where war had just ended to help them in need. They also played baseball and volleyball games in the empty spaces where the animals usest to be.

Luke was a very kind harted person. She never though about just herself. She would go back and do it all over again. Luke was a very thoughful person. Tell me would you ever be a Seagoing Cowgirl.

original_text:
Are you gals bored at home and you got nothing to do? Join our program.

First, our program is about Seagoing Cowgirls. A Seagoing Cowgirls is a program that you take care of the horses, young cows, and mules that were shipped overseas. A Seagoing Cowgirls is like a adventure that you ever had.

Next, sign up are in Europe and this girl Luke sign up. She was having a life time on her adventure. She went to Panama Canal and Crete and China. Luke crossed the Atlantic Ocean 16 times and the Pacific Ocean twice to help people affected by World War II.

Then, it takes her two weeks to cross the Atlantic Ocean to get to China. Luke was busy the whole time. Be care full when working because one rainy night Luke slid down a slippery ladder on her backside, but she is still alive. She also found time to have fun on board, especially on return trips after the animals had been unloaded. The cowgirls played baseball and volleyball games and table-tennis tournament, fencing, boxing, reading, whittling, and games also helped pass the time.

Last, it was a open world for her. She had fun sometimes when her group are done with empty holds where animals had been housed. So join now to become a Seagoing Cowgirls.

original_text:
The Seagoing Cowgirls was part of a program called the UNRRA that helped rebuild cities after World War 11. The Cowgirls transported animals such as, horses, young cows, and mules overseas to the ruined cities. You should become a Seagoing Cowgirl.

Luke became a Seagoing Coyboy after her high school graduation. The reason she joined was because her freind Don invited her to go with her on a cattle boat to Europe. Luke didn't disagree because she knew it would be a opportunity of a lifetime.

If you were to join the Seagoing Cowgirls you would be a part of a very important program. 44 nations united to help the contries in ruins after World War 11. The Seagoing Cowgirls shipped the animals to help the countries regain their food supplies, animals and other things that the countries needed.

Being one of the Cowgirls didn't mean it was all work and no play. During the trips across the oceans you can see China, Greece, and other contries you've probaly never seen before. After a hard days work of cleannig stalls and feeding animals you could play baseball and volleyball in the holds where the animals were kept. Games like fencing, boxing, and table-tennis also kept the Cowgirls ocupied.

There are dangers that come with this important job. Luke was a watchman on her second trip. Her job was to check on the animals every hour. After she made her report to the captian she slipped on a ladder, slick with rain, and started to fall twards the Atlantic. A piece of metal stopped her fall but she couldn't work because she cracked a few ribs.

You should become a Seagoing Cowgirl. It includes great sights, fun, and hard work. If you become a part of the Seagoing Cowgirls you are a part of a great program that saves lives. The job is full of suprises and danger, but it is all worth it because you are helping others.

original_text:
Luke had no idea that her life would change so soon after her high school graduation. She was working two part-time jobs in agrocey store and a bank when her friend Don invited her to go to Europe on a cattle boat. Luke couldn't say no.

In 1945, World War 2 was over in Europe,and manu countries were left ruins. To help these countries recover their food and supplies,animals, and more, 44 nations joined together to help the nation they are called the Seagoing Cowgirls to take care of the horses, young cows, and mules that were shiped overseas.

By the time she was discharged in 1947,Luke had made nine trips-the most of any Seagoing Cowgirl. I had the side benifit of seeing Europe and China. But seeing the Acroplis in Greece was special,she says. So taking a gondola ride in Venice,Italy,a city with streets of water. A cargo of 335 horses plus enough hay and oats to feed them.

It took two weeks to cross the Atlantic Ocean from the eatern coast of the United States and a month to get to china. Caring for animals during the crossings kept Luke busy. They fed the animals three times a day water,bales of hay,and bags of oats. Stalls had to be cleaned.

Being a Seagoing cow was much more than an adventure for Luke. It opened up the world to her. "Im grateful for the opportunity,"she says. It made her more aware of people of other countries and their needs.

In conclusion Luke had the best time of her life being a Seagoing Cowgirl she didn't no her life would change so soon after her high school graduation. In 1945 world war 2 made places get ruined so she decied to go to Seagoing Cowgirls. She help animals like horses,young cows,and mules too. She had so much to do but she did it and yes it was hard but she did what she was suppossed to do. A Seagoing Cow girl was more than an adventure for Luke. It opened the world up to her. She is gratefull of the opportunity.

original_text:
Mooo!

Horses, young cows, and mules are interesting mammels.

Luke Bomberger went on a adventer were she could watch these animals.

She also got to go to Europe and China. Dosen't that sound fun? This paper is about the adventer Luke took. There are many other good parts about taking this trip.

Luke had a oppertunity of a lifetime when she signed up to be a Seagoing Cowgirl. First she got to see the acropolis. Then she got to ride on a gondola to see Venice, Italy. She said she had the time of her life. She also liked watching the animals.

If you like animals you get to take care of them in a boat or water vessle to Europe or Asia.

Some of the animals need help. There also other fun things to do like tennis, fencing, boxing, reading, whittling, baseball, and volleyball.

If you like trips, sports and animals you would be perfect to be a Seagoing Cowgirl. A lot of animals need help.

You can help them by being a Seagoing Cowgirl.

You can have fun too taking a trip or playing sports. Sign up now!

original_text:
So when Luke came back to China she saw even more homeless people than before. So she thought she would have to make a change to that.

So when she was setting up a program for conviencing people to help the homeless Don tried to call and have her come to America and and Luke said, "Don, I can't I have to help the people in China because I see little kids and grown people starving on the street and that hurts me." So then when she had it set up a lot of people came to support it and Luke convienced a lot of people, but also a lot of people not to help. So the applications to sign up there was a fee of ten dollars to help with the grocceries and that was why even more people did not join her.

So when she saw a lot of people without forms she stopped everybody and had a long speech about helping the poor and imagine if you were in their shoes and telling them they didn't want to be like that. So then almost all the people clapped and then walked in and got a form and asked her where to start. She said," Just if you see a homeless person, help her out. So then after she rode her boat to America and helped Don out she came back to China to see how her SeaGoing Cowgirls program was going.

When she came to China she was very happy of how everybody had a house and job and nobody was starving. So she set up a meeting and thanked everybody who supported that program and told them they did a wonderful job and she almost cired of how much she was happy.

So when she rode her boat back to her home town she told Don and Luke's family about what happened and they said they should do that in America and they did and it worked out just as great as China. Her program became national because how good it was and she said it was all the people who helped out she said, "What I love about it was that they didn't have to do but how they did, it just makes me warm inside and very happy." So just seeing homeless people on the street made and making a program had this much of a bennifit. Luke felted great about what she did.

original_text:
In the story "A Cowgirl Who Rode the Waves" Luke was a cowgirl rode the waves. she helped people in Europe after War World 2. Luke went to Europe to help people that didn't have shelter, food or animals. When Luke just graduated highschool her friend Don asked her if she wanted to go to Europe. Luke knew she couldn't pass this opportunity of a lifetime up.44 Nations joined together to form

UNRRA [ther United Nations Relief and Rehabilitaton Administration.] "UNRRA hired "Seagoing Cowgirls" to take care of the horses, young cowes, and mules that were shipped overseas. Luke and Don signed up." Luke wanted to help people if she didn't go she wouldn't like to help people.

'Luke did get some free time when she was on the boat she got to see Venice, Italy she also toured an excavated castle in Crete and mareled at the Panama

China" she got to see many things many people don't get the chance to ever see. It was an aventure for her. "it took about to weeks to cross the Atlantic Ocean from the eastern coast of the United States and a month to get to china" It was hard work to keep ever animal safe and alive on the long journey and animals could have died of sickness and cancer and a lot of other thing like not getting any excercie. " Heping out on her aunt Katie's farm as a girl had prepared Luke for hard work, but not for dangers at sea. On Lukes second trip, Luke served as night watchman. Her job awas to cheack on all the animals every hour. One rainy night, after making her hourly report to the captian, she slid down a slippery ladder on her backside. Luke's haert raced as she shot feet firt toward an opening on the side of the ship. a small strip of metal along the edge stopped her slide, keeping her from flying overborad into the dark Atlantic. She was happy to be alive. But she couyld not work for a coulpe of days because of vraked ribs." She was really happy to be alive and she was ok with craked ribs because she was alive.

Reasons that people like Luke became or are going to be a Seagoing

Cowgirl is because they like to help people in need that need food a shelter. They don't just do it to go to Europe and see everything and to have fun, they do it because they care about other people.
